intro: Psychotria potanthera subsp. potanthera, commonly known as the purple psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ethnobotanical studies.
